This page helps you to create policies that can be used to get approval for the relevant allocation. Each user can create only one Auto Submit - Approval policy, and multiple rules can be added to a single policy.

 

Filters
  • User Id

 

Creating an Auto Submit - Approval Policy

 

To create a new Auto Submit - Approval Policy:

 

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Allocation > Auto Submit-Approval Policies.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Click Create to view the Create New Auto Submit-Approval Policies window.
  4. Select a User Id and click Save and Continue.
  5. Click Add New to specify rules for auto approval. Enter a value for Auto Approval Criteria Id and Description. Choose Yes or No for Enabled Auto Approval to enable automatic approval for the policy, and click on Save and Continue. On the Auto Approval Conditions page, choose the Attribute, Operator, and Value to create a relevant condition that should be met for the policy to be auto approved. You can create multiple conditions and groups of conditions if required, or select This is a catch-all rule for the policy to adhere to all possible conditions.
  6. Click Save and Finish.
Note: All mandatory fields are denoted with *.

 

Editing an Auto Submit - Approval Policy

 

You can edit an Auto Submit - Approval Policy policy using one of the below procedures:

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Allocation > Auto Submit-Approval Policies.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Select the required policy. Swipe-out the menu on the required record card and select Edit.
  4. In the edit Auto Submit-Approval Policies window, modify the required fields.
  5. Click Save and Finish to save the modified policy details.

Edit View

  1. Select the required policy record card. The action buttons are displayed in the footer section.
  2. Click Edit to view the edit Auto Submit-Approval Policies window.
  3. Click Save and Finish to save the modified policy details.

Deleting an Auto Submit - Approval Policy

 

The policy records can be deleted by following one of the below procedures:

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configurations > Allocation > Auto Submit-Approval Policies.
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Swipe-out menu on the required record card and select Delete.
  4. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Auto Approval Policy is irreversible'.
  5. Click Yes to delete the policy.

Delete

  1. Select the required record card. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. Select Delete.
  3. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'Deletion of Auto Approval Policy is irreversible'.
  4. Click Yes to delete the policy.
Field Description

Following are the field descriptions of the attributes available on the screen.

 

Field

 

Description

 
User Id Specifies the user id which has created the policy.
Updated Time Stamp Specifies the date and time when the policy was updated.

 

Action Buttons

Following are the action buttons available on the screen.

 

Create Opens the Create New Auto Submit-Approval Policies window. 
Deselect Clears the selected records.
Edit Opens the relevant Auto Submit-Approval Policies window.
Delete Deletes the selected record.
